meanings.definition: A row of cut hay or grain left to dry in the wind.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered the windrow of hay to feed the animals.
meanings.sent2: The sun shone on the windrow of grain, drying it out for storage.
meanings.sent3: The windrow of hay decided to have a picnic in the field.
meanings.sent4: The windrow of grain stood tall like soldiers in the field.
meanings.sent5: The windrow of hay danced in the breeze, a golden wave in the meadow.

meanings.definition: To arrange in a row or rows.
meanings.sent1: She decided to windrow the books on the shelf for easy access.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will windrow the flowers along the path for a beautiful display.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to windrow their toys but ended up in a mess.
meanings.sent4: He windrowed his thoughts, organizing them neatly in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist will windrow the colors on the canvas to create a stunning painting.
